intro: Hippocratea obtusifolia f. crassior, commonly known as the thick-leaved hippocratea, is a botanical variant of the species Hippocratea obtusifolia. It is characterized by its broader, more robust leaves compared to the typical form, which contributes to its distinctive appearance. This plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of Thailand and Malaysia. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories.
